intro: Hieracium tenuifloccosum, commonly known as the slender floccose hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with fine, silky hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium tenuifloccosum is often found in open habitats and can spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in some areas.
